ratings.comment: Easy to get an A if you are a good writer. Boring lecturer. Students make fun of her because she is not inspirational like other GWS profs.

Professor Ewig's lectures were pretty bland at first, but they got more interesting and empowering later on. Discussion sections have participation grades (so it's mandatory) but don't let that scare you off. It's a decent class, but we had a lot of boring articles to read (the "textbook") for just a three credit course. My TA was a tough grader.

As an GWS major, this class proved pretty disappointing and not at all representative of other GWS classes or profs. While the subject material was interesting, Professor Ewig is NOT a great lecturer. She is very awkward to listen to and tends to ramble. I also wished she would have included more global content- often it seemed like an afterthought

She's very awkward to listen to- she tends to pause so often that you need to concentrate very hard on her sentences. I found that she tended to be extremely vague in her lectures and never gave clear cut examples. For example, she will throw a quote on a slide and then ramble in a extremely vaque way of how it matches a "world" view.

Fun lecturer and gives good examples and visual representations of material (i.e. youtube videos or movies). Does assign more than one paper, attendance is checked throughout the semester through pop reflections, and lots of readings. Readings were a bit excessive but worthwhile in understanding lecture material.

TOO MUCH READING. If you want to take an interesting class that won't be too demanding this course is NOT for you. I took this class because intro courses are always fun and you learn a lot without the intense  pressure. This class had way too many readings ( approx. 6-8/week). Content was good, too demanding for 100 level class. Also, tough grader

Great professor. She really knows her material and is very approachable. I would definitely take a class with her again. She is a tough grader but this was a 600-level course so that's to be expected.

Poorly structured grading system based on pop quizzes on material not covered in class (readings). Large parts of grade is also based on participation which can be bad or good. Really nice lady who tries to take interest in her students. Just wasn't organized and structured enough for me.

Really upbeat and fun professor.  Easy to follow and uses lots of powerpoint slides.  Lots of reading, and most of it is pretty dense.  Also be prepared to participate, because she makes a big deal of it.  Assignments are too demanding.  three 6 page papers and a simulation.  Take the class, it was better than expected.
she's so nice

Professor is passionate about her subject. It is clear at every lecture. The subject material, her examples, and the readings are interesting, and she makes sure to be inclusive and really teach about feminism and gender in the global perspective. Loved her lectures. Take her class.

Amazing professor. Incredibly knowledgeable, always available to help you, and very passionate about the topic and her students.  Would highly recommend taking a class with her, this has been one of my favorite classes at Madison by far!
Super easy class, they actually give you the questions that will be on exams before you take them. Easy A, and you can tell the professor loves the topic.

Great class! You definitely have to work for your grade, but Professor Ewig is an awesome professor and I left the class feeling motivated and empowered. Discussions are fun, but be sure to keep up with readings from the course pack.

I feel like I owe it to all future students to warn them that this class isn't an easy A. The reading are dull, long, and outdated and the TA's tear apart your papers. Normally, 15% of the class gets an A, opposed to around 50% of 101 and 103, so if you want to take a gender and women's class just for kicks and a good, easy grade, don't take 102.

The class is interesting enough. However, the TA's grade very tough. You have two papers (both short) a midterm, and a final. This class is not an easy A by any means. But you will learn a lot. Christina is a very good lecturer.

The class is not hard at all but the papers are tricky depending on how your TA grades. The first few exams are not hard as long as you prepare for them. The topics we cover are interesting and the prof is really into what she teaches. I loved it but wish i had the other TA.
good class. she's ok. read the articles that are assigned.

I loved this class and Ewig was a great professor, not only did she upload her slides, but she kept with them in class and added to them/clarified them throughout the lecture.  Some of the readings were difficult, but if you have any interest in Latin American politics I would highly recommend this course and Ewig.

This is not a hard class at all. Just go to lecture, and do the readings because they will come up in exams and discussion. The exams are not hard overall, go over important terms and you'll be fine. If you're interested in topics like feminism and learning some history about women, you'll like the class

I had an awful, truly dreadful TA, and Ewig was just about as useless.  I tried to discuss with each of them what they wanted from my papers.  Somehow I got a D on one, and an A on the other.  The grading was weird.  I learned a lot, but not from lecture-instead the readings.  Take a different class if you're interested in the subject.  Seriously.

Some lectures are really interesting, some it's hard to stay awake. Attend class, she does "pop reflections" randomly for attendance. Do readings (scan for general message of it) and keep note cards of them. She's passionate about the subject. Discussions are interesting. If you pay attention and can write a paper, you'll get an A.

The class is easy if you pay attention--attend lecture, do the readings and repeat back in your essays what she says. There is no room for criticism, she only wants to hear what she thinks is right, but if you do that it's an easy A. Honestly, I got 100% on the midterm just by doing the readings and remembering authors.

My TA was fun and the class material was interesting, but Ewig continuously throws her opinion into every aspect of her "teaching." Classes are supposed to stimulate thought and allow students to formulate their own opinions on subject matter, not be bombarded with uber-feminist ideals that may or may not hold true.

Ick.  This class is just obnoxious-and this is coming from a feminist.  The grading is jacked up and hyper competitive.  If you don't brown nose well, I suggest taking another professor.  Also, she isn't a big fan of views contradictory to her own.  So just stick with regurgitating exactly what she says.  She loves brainless copies.

This class sucks.  The actual material covered in the course is really interesting and valuable, but this professor is trying to cover every oppressed group of people on earth, when really, all I signed up for was a 3-credit WOMENS STUDIES COURSE!  This class is WAY more work than its worth.  Honestly, it only fills 3 credits for social sciences.

Marvelous, she is good in lecture and speaks at a rate that was really good for 8:50 in the morning.  She doesn't go too fast or slow.  She got me excited about the subject. There is only one exam and it's not too difficult if you answer the questions in a really straight forward manner. Take this class if you like to think about stuff.

This class is no good.  TAs gave terrible grades, and when I asked why, they couldn't give me an answer.  The class caters to Ewig's personal views on the topic-so very biased.  Interesting subject-don't let this class ruin your interest.  Lecture is useless, definitions skewed and require looking up on Wikipedia.
Worst TA I've ever had. Very nice teacher--she makes an effort to learn everyone's name, but her lectures are boring.
Awesome teacher!  Really involved and helpful.  Great concepts.  You learn a lot!  Take this class!!
boring lecturer- ta's are really hard graders and take points off for no reason and when asked, don't explain why you got the grade you did. not even an interesting class

terrible, all i can say is that she gave us thanksgiving break to write a paper she hadn't even given us all the material on, tottally b.s.ed it.  ruined this subject for me. exam was very repeitive yet i lost points because i kept on answering the same question that appeared four times. don't take this class the slides don't make any sense.
Awful teacher. Very hard grader. Strong opinions with no evidence. Unorganized lecture topics.
I would comment about her teaching ability, however, I am unable to because this woman doesn't teach.
she is absolutely horrible. the defines concepts with other concepts. she disregards suggestions. hard graders.
wow, she's bad.  very one-sided and boring to listen to. don't take this class if she's teaching it.  exams are a crock.
No Comments
